meanings.definition: A small space created by building part of a wall further back from the rest.
meanings.sent1: The recesses in the library are perfect for quiet reading.
meanings.sent2: She found a cozy nook in the recesses of the garden to relax.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to hide in the recesses behind the sofa.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts often wander into the recesses of her mind.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the recesses of the cave was an exciting adventure.

meanings.definition: A period of time during which an activity is temporarily stopped.
meanings.sent1: During recesses at school, children play outside.
meanings.sent2: The meeting had to be paused for a short recess.
meanings.sent3: Taking a recess from work can help clear your mind.
meanings.sent4: The recesses between study sessions are important for retention.
meanings.sent5: Let's take a recess and grab a snack before continuing.

meanings.definition: The innermost part or the most secret part.
meanings.sent1: The recesses of her heart held deep emotions.
meanings.sent2: He kept his most prized possessions in the recesses of his closet.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map led to the hidden recesses of the island.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the recesses of the old mansion revealed a hidden room.
meanings.sent5: The recesses of the forest were untouched by human hands.
